intro: Auriculardisia dukei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, tuberous roots and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, brightly colored flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Auriculardisia dukei is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in bright, indirect light and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
